post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
Hey guys, I was just wondering would someone be able to make me a couple of model props for total recall. What I need is a few paint buckets/brushes and a palm tree. I hope any of you skilled modellers can help me out here.

Thanks.

post.author: solarsplace
post.body:
Hi

In the interests of actually one time someone comes to help from a post on D3 world job advertisement boards.....

I can do a bucket and paint brush for you.

Send me a Google picture link of what you want exactly.

Not done any trees before so probably cannot help there.

Cheers

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
Nice solarspace, I'm looking for 3 types of paint cans.

The first can should be half used with paint dripping down the sides and you could maybe have the brush in the can. Colour it purple like in the image if you can.
http://www.wired.com/images_blogs/photo ... intcan.jpg

The next two cans should be unused with lids on them but with different colours like purple and red or blue. You could make these cans have the carry strap in carry position. You could use the same design as this next image if you like but change the logo text from Mythic to Henry's please.
http://mystagedlife.com/wp-content/uplo ... -paint.jpg

Any old paint brush/roller will do.

Thanks again solarspace, appreciated. If you've any questions just ask...


*Bump* Once again I am still in need of a palm tree model.

post.author: reko
post.body:
http://www.moddb.com/downloads/palm-tree-model

[Nevermind what was here] Also I haven't even seen a pic of it, so I'm not sure if it's good.

http://archive3d.net/?category=441

post.author: solarsplace
post.body:
No probs.

Got a few things on atm so give me a few days.

Cheers

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: Thanks guys, one more thing...I'll need the models in *.lwo format if you can

post.author: solarsplace
post.body:
Douglas Quaid wrote:
Thanks guys, one more thing...I'll need the models in *.lwo format if you can


Hi

Do you have to have them in .LWO why not .ASE?

http://www.katsbits.com/tutorials/idtec ... models.php

cheers

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: ase works too

post.author: solarsplace
post.body:
Hi DQ

Before I do the pots with the lids on and the brush, thought I'd better check you like this model?





Cheers

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body:
Nice work sofar, looking forward to the finished versions!

Edit: Also, if you could will you please convert the palm tree model in reko's post to *.ase...I'd appreciate that.

post.author: solarsplace
post.body:
Hi

Looks like whoever made the palm used 3d max's equivalent of Blenders 'modifiers' and so the model only has 1 leaf when imported into Blender. TBH the model is not that great and the origin is set in a funny position. Would be best to ask someone who has max to fix it for you or better still do a new model. Sorry cannot make it into a D3 compatible model for you.

cheers

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: That's fine solarsplace, thanks for taking a look at it anyway.

post.author: reko
post.body:
Oh... well
Then wtb those?
http://artist-3d.com/free_3d_models/06nature_design.php

post.author: solarsplace
post.body:
Hi

The models are done (to the best of my abilities anyway).



I'll PM you with the DL details.

Cheers
